website_summaries.verdict: The manufacturer states that you can secure all types of gear with these 10-foot straps, including "delicate" items. The weight limit is stated at 800 pounds.
pros: Straps can be linked (be sure to do this correctly)
cons: A single strap may be too short for some hauling needs

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This style strap is very frustrating to use. it's too difficult to start the strap started through the 1/8" razor thin buckle opening. once you get it started, it's fine. But the ones they sell at home depot are much easier to use because they give you a half inch buckle opening and work the exact same way. these work fine if you have the patience to wrestle threading through the hole each time you use them. But for daily use, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Orange Tie down straps with cam buckle
customer_reviews.text: Came in on time and I'll make the assumption that they will work as advertised. Bright orange will clash with the bright green one's I purchased which is exactly what I wanted to secure the arse end of my kayak gear so traffic can see me for miles. Now if they hold up for the entire year into 2020, that is another question? If they don't, you will hear about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ret. Lt. Col. A.D

customer_reviews.title: These are literal junk
customer_reviews.text: The webbing is paper thin, and the buckle is the cheapest chinese pot metal I've ever seen ever. Seriously. Stay far away, these will get you killed if you try to use them for anything. 800lb WLL is straight up delusional.
customer_reviews.author: S. Buck

customer_reviews.title: No more hooks, strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: For years I used the cambuckle type with hooks. The hooks are always a pain and I simply never thought about using ones w/o hooks. I use these to strap a cooler to a hitch carrier and to strap by cargo carrier tighter. I have been on two long road trips and they never loosened one bit.
customer_reviews.author: CKDad

customer_reviews.title: Tend to swell at ends.
customer_reviews.text: These straps tend to swell at the ends, to the point they will not fit in the slot. So it is rendered useless. Go with the Thule brand instead, they are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Hepler

customer_reviews.title: Great for tying down kayak on J-Racks
customer_reviews.text: Use these on my kayak racks and there is no long tail to tie up - as was the case with my other, long ratchet straps securely hold kayaks on my roof rack without any issues
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: great for use intended.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is perfect in a product meant for tie downs or weight holding, but for the money, tis is the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Strong, secure easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to strap down an ocean kayak. Perfect size to thread through holes in kayak and then roof rack. Four pack of straps just right amount to secure kayak with two in the middle and one on either end!
customer_reviews.author: Happy as a Clam

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but a bit short and thin
customer_reviews.text: I ordered straps in the past and was hoping for something similar. There are a bit short for my needs (strap kayaks on a roof rack) and a bit thin. I hope they will be strong enough for highway driving with the kayak. Next time, I might go for something stronger
customer_reviews.author: Piero Chiodo

customer_reviews.title: threading the buckle is frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Great strong strap, works well on kayaks/j bars However, the buckle design is bad, very hard to thread. I will replace them with something easier to thread.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Well designed strap and buckle that fit my needs well.
customer_reviews.author: DWalden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and value. Easy to use and very practical.
customer_reviews.author: WallyT

customer_reviews.title: Check Lengths of Straps!
customer_reviews.text: These straps were smaller than I expected, but because there are four of them you can get the job done easily. I use just a single strap for my paddle board on my smaller subaru and it works just perfectly. With the kayaks, multiple would still need to be used although not a huge hassel. Easy to use, straight forward, durable!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Howard

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Holds very well. Using it to tie down 2x4 studs for the drive home from the lumber store. NOT a lot of lumber all at once. Just a couple of 8 foot studs. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G

customer_reviews.title: Oregon
customer_reviews.text: Seem fine. .. haven't yet had occasion to use them. Shipping was speedy and the straps are just as pictured. Would have love a slightly heavier material.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: These are really good straps/buckles. My only issue is that there is ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really good straps/buckles. My only issue is that there is no backing pad under the buckle to protect the item from the buckle...but as the buckle is not sharp that is a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Ok buckle, good webbing.
customer_reviews.text: Ancra makes the best cam strap I've found. These have nice webbing but the buckle is cheaper than Ancra or Powertye. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: jgrove

customer_reviews.title: Good value and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the cam buckle tie downs. I prefer this style to other two-piece styles that use hooks. The 10' length is usable for many applications...not too long, not too short. I would buy them again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Could not believe how great they were will purchase more..
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: locked securely
customer_reviews.text: These do well for all the things a strap should do. My kayak is on my van now and is secure.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Langdon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I expected...I had been looking for a "no-hook" ratchet strap but cannot find
customer_reviews.author: Backroads Jones

customer_reviews.title: Strong straps
customer_reviews.text: Loves these straps to hold down my kayak in the back of my truck
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using these for a suspension system for my canoe in the barn rafters. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for strapping kayak to roof rack. Very nice durable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great for kayak
customer_reviews.text: Excellent straps. Using to tie down 14' touring kayak. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked to tie down trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Tie down strap worked to anchor trampoline. They started to fade but if they hold up I don't care if fade
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for Thule straps
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for my Thule Thule straps. Just as good and over 1/2 the cost
customer_reviews.author: david j.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and made well
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I even stood up some fallen trees with these straps.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Hamburger

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my kayak
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed to tie my kayak down to my roof.
customer_reviews.author: gjw

customer_reviews.title: The straps seem well made and are incredibly light. ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps seem well made and are incredibly light. The straps seem to be a different material from other straps I've seen. I haven't tested it yet, but if it holds up, the lightness is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Aswang

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think about it but the strap was too short ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think about it but the strap was too short for my needs. WAS NOT sellers fault...it was clearly posted in description...I just wasn't thinking about what length I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Just like advertised
customer_reviews.text: They were the perfect size to secure my kayaks to my J-racks. Held them very secure and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome straps! Used them to secure my bike down a 900 mile trip to Colorado! Worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: they work great... like that there was 4, cant say much more about tie down strips
customer_reviews.author: supernycmommy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine but have only used them once, seem to be of good quality
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Craig

customer_reviews.title: They are very strong and hold up great!
customer_reviews.text: I use these straps for securing a kayak during transport. They are very strong and hold up great!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I was looking for but were as ...
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I was looking for but were as advertised and I'll use for another application. Quality product shipped in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised! used it to hold down my kayak on my pick up truck. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Erik G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality lash straps, and the seller followed up twice to ensure I was satisfied; I am.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t need the straps after all but the package and the 4 straps came as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to use these, but the lock seems strong.
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: One star per strap. So.... one star
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let the multiple straps shown in the photos (including in packaging) fool you. I received a single strap in the mail today. No idea yet how well it works because I need minimum two to strap down a canoe. One star per strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Parker

customer_reviews.title: as those that came with the carrier were not so great. These are a really nice quality at a ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these to lash my kayaks to my car, as those that came with the carrier were not so great. These are a really nice quality at a really nice price. Glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Cam buckle Tie Down Straps
customer_reviews.text: Great value, very durable and do exactly what they're supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: JamieF

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 came.
customer_reviews.text: Straps work great. Only 3 came instead of 4. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Martie Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too short and too thin for a canoe on a roof rack. Buckle works well though
customer_reviews.author: Raine

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: thought they would be more heavy duty waist of money
customer_reviews.author: R. E.  Wells

customer_reviews.title: tie downs
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the crank type but get the job done! I haven't had a chance to use these yet and will report back when I do!
customer_reviews.author: Krish

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these to hold my 250 cubic ft argon tank to the welding cart; I use two of them, and the load does not shift. Overall these are a very good deal for the price, and the cam buckle grabs well enough that I am sure it won't slip. I'd buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary London

product_meta.title: TIEDWN STRP TITAN ORG25"
product_meta.description:
Mount Kayaks and Canoes Safely and Effectively!

When it comes to transporting a kayak or canoe, mounting it to your car’s roof rack is the only 
practical option. And while a lot of tie down straps are great for heavy-duty hauls, you can easily 
over tighten them, damaging your delicate boat in the process.

Cam Buckle Lashing Straps from Titan Auto provide a secure hold without harming your cargo! 
Great for kayaks and canoes of any material, our straps are strong yet lightweight, ensuring the 
frame of your boat remains undamaged. Measuring 1” by 10' each, they’re long enough for 
larger items and offer portable convenience.

The secret to our straps’ strength is in high tenacity polyester fiber! This incredible material 
absorbs water, making it ideal for virtually any climate or weather condition. With a breaking 
strength of 2400lbs, everything you transport will arrive safe and sound. The best part? They 
take less than a minute to install and require no complicated tools or devices!

Titan Auto is the go-to shop for haulers who need strength, durability and long lasting designs! 
All of our straps use super-tough polyester for unmatched reliability, while our cam buckles are 
made of rust and rot-resistant zinc alloy.

Why Choose Our Lashing Straps?

- Ideal for delicate gear
- Great in any climate or weather condition
- Install in under a minute
- Lightweight and portable
- Made with zinc alloy and high tenacity polyester
Try Today Risk Free with Our 1-Year Money Back Guarantee!

Order Your Lashing Straps Now for Safe, Go-Anywhere Convenience!
feature_bullets: Secure, Reliable Hold: Every great adventure starts by loading up the car! When you use our cam buckle straps, you can secure gear directly to any vehicle’s roof rack for portable convenience. At 1” by 10' each, they’re perfect for larger cargo like a kayak or a canoe.

Strong and Versatile: Boasting a breaking strength of 2400lbs and a working load limit of an incredible 800lbs, you can rest assured knowing our cargo straps are ready for any job! They even absorb water without damaging, so they’re great for any damp, humid climate.

Setup in Seconds: Unbelievably easy to use, our cam straps tie down cargo in less than 60 seconds and require no complicated devices! Travel confidently knowing your luggage is safely in place, or use them for storage or when moving for a broad range of versatility.

Designed for Durability: The Titan Auto name has become synonymous with high quality towing accessories you can trust! These load straps feature high tenacity polyester fibers and rust-resistant zinc alloy, continuing our commitment to durable, long lasting designs.

Shop Risk Free: Our team prides itself on our ability to offer a personal customer service experience! When you purchase our tie straps, you’ll also receive our 1-year money back guarantee. If you’re not completely satisfied, you can return them – no questions asked!
